subject: Weeklong Wild Spirit Wolf Sanctuary Charity Drive
event: ENDING SOON!!! Our supply of DANCE WITH DRAGONS is sold out, but there are still copies of the CAPTAIN OF GUARDS chapbook available for a $10 donation to the wolves. ================================================================== I've always been fond of wolves... direwolves in Westeros, and real wolves in the real world. Wolves have faced a tough road for the last century or so. US wolf populations hit critical lows during the twentieth century, and finding a way for humans to co-exist with this majestic creatures is an important part of the conservation movement. Here in my home state of New Mexico, we have the Wild Spirit Wolf Sanctuary (http://www.wildspiritwolfsanctuary.org/index.php) doing important work in protecting the animals and in educating their two legged neighbors on how to get along. It's work I strongly support, with both my words and my checkbook. I invite you to join me over the next week. In conjunction with Wild Spirit, I'm sponsoring a charity drive to raise funds for the shelter. For the next week, we'll be offering a pair of items from my personal library to people making donations. You can find the books being offered and the donation amounts here: http://www.wildspiritwolfsanctuary.org/georgemartin_bookfund.php For a donation of $100 to the Wild Spirit Sanctuary, I will send you a first edition hardcover of A DANCE WITH DRAGONS, autographed... autographed and personally inscribed (upon request). For the most part I have been forced to stop doing personal inscriptions at my bookstore signings, con appearances, and the like... the crowds have simply gotten too large... so this is a rare chance for those who'd like to have a book personalizations. But the offer is limited to forty (40) copies, first come, first served. So if you want one, click on the link and make that donation NOW. For those who can't afford a hundred bucks, or arrive at the party too late after the forty copies are gone, we have another offering -- a special promotional chapbook featuring the "Captain of the Guards" chapter from A FEAST FOR CROWS. This was prepared by Bantam as a promotional item for the BEA (Book Expo America) and was given away to attendees at that event, but copies were never sold in any bookstore, so it's a pretty cool collectible for the fans who have everything, and a $10 donation to the sanctuary will snag you a copy. I will be glad to sign these items as well -- but, alas, only a straight signature, no personalization or inscription. So $10 will get you a signed CAPTAIN OF THE GUARDS, and $100 will get you a signed and inscribed DANCE WITH DRAGONS. But don't do it for the books. Do it because the world would be a much worse place without this face in it. THIS DRIVE WILL END ON SATURDAY AT MIDNIGHT. So if you would like to make a donation and give some wolves a hand, act now. Do it for House Stark. If we raise enough money, maybe I'll let some Starks live a little longer...

props.taglist: charity, dance with dragons, signed books

Mr. Martin, Ty & Fans!!!

Please share this with anyone who is a fan of Mr. Martin and/or Wild Spirit Wolf Sanctuary, we have more and many, Feast for Crows Chapbooks available!!!

George Stapleton

comments.subject: GRRM Book Fundraiser and WSWS

comments.article:
the good folks of WSWS do so much work to care for the animals that have come to live at the sanctuary, and their educational programs are essential.

Not only does WSWS care for pure wolves, but they also have wolf-hybrid animals. It is a very rare person who has the training, the ability, even the type of property to live on with a wolf-hybrid. There are restrictions in many counties that ban or heavily restrict the ownership of wolf-hybrids. Even people who are successful living and caring for their animals, outside circumstances, such as the loss of a job and property where they live with their animal, a divorce or serious illness can mean that they can no longer care for their wolf-hybrids. WSWS has taken in some of the animals that otherwise be abandoned, or even put to death.

WSWS also has a small pack of the rare and endangered New Guinea SInging Dogs, rescued from an animal hoarder. Sadly, they cannot be used to protect the breed because they had been inter-bred by the hoarder. But they are wonderful creatures, and are thriving at WSWS. Go look at the pictures and read about them at the WSWS web site!

People even drop off dogs that need a new home, and WSWS cares for them and finds them new homes. Like many rural counties, there aren't a lot of options for lost, abandoned animals.

There are other wolf/wolf-hybrid sanctuaries in the US, there might be one near you. Even a small donation of cash, or a gift card for the sanctuary is meaningful to the organization, so if you can, please do make a donation or offer to help in whatever way you can.

I became a 'wolf-mother' many years ago when the Brotherhood Without Banners gave me a sponsorship of a wolf-hybrid named Sasquatch as a Yule present. Sasquatch passed over the Rainbow Bridge a long time ago, but I remained a supporter of WSWS. WSWS offers books about wolves, and the personal memoirs of people who worked and lived with wolves/hybrids. They have many wonderful gifts that support their work, so if you have a friend or loved one who likes wolves, please think of giving them a gift from WSWS for their next birthday or mid-Winter holiday present.

thanks to all, and one big happy howl of joy!
comments.subject: thanks to everyone who is donating to WSWS

comments.article:
Parris;

Thank you so much for your recognition of the work we do!! You and George have been long time faithful supporters of our organization, and we appreciate so much what you both have done for us over the years! As you so eloquently put, we do more than just take care of Wolves, we have Wolfdogs and our little Singing Girls and Boys too. The amazing turnout of George's fans for our cause is so heart warming, I am carried away on a tide of emotion just thinking about it. I went and sat with ALL of our Wolves, Wolfdogs, & Singers today and told them what was happening in our Human world, and you know what? I believe that they understood me, all of them, each and every one did something to make me feel that they understood. I do not spend much time with people, and when you spend time with the Animals here like that, you develop a sense of "picture" communication with them. I wish to share that feeling with you and George, come see us when you can! I want you both to feel what the Wolves of Wild Spirit have to share. You are saving souls that would been long gone, and now you have opened your world to WSWS, thank you Parris. As our Wolves say, "AHHHHOOOOOOOOO!!!!!
comments.subject: Re: thanks to everyone who is donating to WSWS
Re: thanks to everyone who is donating to WSWS

comments.subject: quick question

comments.article: What a wonderful thing to do :)
Nice to see someone with a celebrity status using their status for the right cause. I sure hope the "some Starks live a little longer..." applies to Arya.

Hi George! In Wisconsin one night a beautiful blond wolf stopped in front of my car and just stared at me for a long moment. I contacted the wildlife people and they were really excited because I was able to help them find the pack of only like 10 wolves so they could track them. I always remember that experience for some reason. It was very unworldly.

Thanks for taking care of the wolves. I will make a donation to the cause.

Sheila from TZ (Glad you have a new photo on your page!!)
